{{also|Appendix:Variations of "us"}}
==English==
{{wikipedia}}

===Etymology 1===
{{etymon|en|id=pronoun|inh|enm>us>pronoun|tree=1}}
From {{inh|en|enm|us}}, from {{inh|en|ang|ūs||pos=dative personal pronoun|us}}, from {{inh|en|gem-pro|*uns||us}}, from {{der|en|ine-pro|*ne-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*nō-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*n-ge-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*n̥smé||us}}. The compensatory lengthening was lost in Middle English due to the word being unstressed while being used. Cognate with {{cog|stq|uus|t=us}}, {{cog|fy|us}}, {{m|fy|us|ús|us}}, {{cog|nds|us||us}}, {{cog|nl|ons||us}}, {{cog|de|uns||us}}, {{cog|da|os||us}}, {{cog|la|nōs||we, us}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{qualifier|stressed}} {{enPR|ŭs}}, {{IPA|en|/ʌs/|/ʌz/}}, {{IPA|en|/ʊs/|a=Local Dublin}}
* {{qualifier|unstressed}} {{IPA|en|/əs/|a=US}}, {{IPA|en|/əs/|/əz/|a=UK}}
* {{audio|en|en-us-us.ogg|a=US}}
* {{rhymes|en|ʌs|s=1}}

====Pronoun====
{{en-pron}}

# {{lb|en|personal}} [[me|Me]] and at least one other person; the objective case of '''[[we]]'''.
#* {{RQ:KJV|Luke|1|1|text=Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among '''us'''...}}
#: {{non-gloss|Used where "me" would be used instead of "I", e.g. for the pronoun in isolation or as the complement of the copula:}}
#:: {{ux|en|Who's there? &mdash;'''Us'''. (or) &mdash;It's '''us'''.}}
#:: {{ux|en|Who's going to go? &mdash;'''Us'''. We'll go.}}
# {{lb|en|Commonwealth|colloquial|chiefly with {{m|en|give}}}} [[me|Me]].
#: {{ux|en|Give '''us''' a look at your paper.}}
#: {{ux|en|Give '''us''' your wallet!}}
#: {{ux|en|She's turned the [[weans]] against '''us'''!}}
# {{lb|en|Northern England}} [[our|Our]].
#: {{ux|en|We'll have to throw '''us''' food out.}}
# {{lb|en|Northumbria}} Me (in all contexts).
#: {{ux|en|Look at '''us''' while you’re speaking to '''us'''.}}
#: {{ux|en|Could you do that for '''us'''?}}

=====Alternative forms=====
* {{alt|en|-'s||contracted form, as in {{m|en|let's}}}}
* {{alt|en|uz|is|iz||Northumbria}}

|passage=Because the flash devices are local to the server, the latencies can be microseconds ('''us''') instead of milliseconds (ms) and eliminate some traffic that would normally have gone over the storage network.}}

==Central Franconian==

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|gmw-cfr|/us/|q2=stressed optionally|/uːs/}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{inh|gmw-cfr|gmh|ūz}}, from {{inh|gmw-cfr|gem-pro|*ūt}}.

====Preposition====
{{head|gmw-cfr|preposition|+ dative}}

# {{lb|gmw-cfr|Ripuarian|parts of|_|Moselle Franconian}} [[out of]], [[from]]
#* {{quote-text|gmw-cfr|year=1936|title=Inscription on the {{w|lang=de|Schwarze Katz}} well in {{w|Zell (Mosel)|Zell}}
|passage=He steiht ferm wie en Zeller '''us''' dem Hamm.|t=He stands firm as a Zell man '''from''' the ''Hamm'' [i.e. the Moselle bow around Zell with its steeply sloped vineyards].}}

=====Usage notes=====
* Where it occurs in Moselle Franconian, it generally does so only in unstressed position while the stressed form is {{m|gmw-cfr|aus}}, {{m|gmw-cfr|ous}}.

=====Alternative forms=====
* {{alt|gmw-cfr|uus|uss}}
* {{alt|gmw-cfr|aus|ous||Moselle Franconian}}

===Etymology 2===
From {{inh|gmw-cfr|gmh|uns}}, from {{inh|gmw-cfr|gem-pro|*uns}}, {{m|gem-pro|*unsiz}}. Loss of the nasal is due to a sporadic development (analogous to the Ingvaeonic nasal spirant-law, but later and not systematic); compare {{cog|lb|eis}}, {{cog|li|ós}}.

====Pronoun====
